arm_group.description: during surgery 7 ml/kg/hr RL during first intraoperative hr, 5 ml/kg/hr for the subsequent hours.After surgery ( PACU) 1,5 ml/kg/hr;After operation ward on the day of surgery 1,5 ml/kg/hr; Postoperative day 1- 1,5 ml/kg/hr RL, oral fluids;Postoperative day 2-oral fluids and solid food according to surgical allowance.

during surgery-RL according to "4-2-1"  4 ml/kg/hr for first 10 kg (=40ml/hr) then 2 ml/kg/hr for next 10 kg (=20ml/hr)then 1 ml/kg/hr for any kg over 20 kg of weight. This always gives 60ml/hr for first 20 kg then you add 1 ml/kg/hr for each kg over 20 kg.
After surgery (PACU):"4-2-1" rule. After operation ward on the day of surgery 1,5 ml/kg/hr.Postoperative day 1:1,5 ml/kg/hr RL, oral fluids. Postoperative day 2:oral fluids and solid food according to surgical allowance.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study was to quantify the Intraocular Pressure (IOP) changes in patients
      undergoing laparoscopic  hysterectomy  at different time points and body positions
      throughout the procedure, and to explore the influence of perioperative fluid management on
      the fluctuations of IOP during perioperative period.

clinical_study.brief_title: Influence of Perioperative Fluid Management on Intraocular Pressure During Hynecologic Laparoscopic Pelvic Surgery
clinical_study.condition: Influence of Perioperative Fluid Regime on Intraocular Pressure During Laparoscopic Gynecologic Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  50-60 adult female patients,

          -  ASA physical status I or II,

          -  scheduled for elective hynecologic laparoscopic pelvic surgery will be included in
             the study.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients will be  excluded if they are > 70 and < 18 yr of age,

          -  had have a body weight > 150% of their ideal body weight,

          -  have  acute or chronic eye disease,

          -  receive any medication known to alter IOP, or

          -  have any mental illnesses.

clinical_study.official_title: Influence of Perioperative Fluid Management on Intraocular Pressure During Hynecologic Laparoscopic Pelvic Surgery

primary_outcome.measure: measurements of intraocular pressure during laparoscopic gynecologic surgery a sa function of diffrent perioperative fluid regimes.
IOP will be  measured using a Tono-pen® XL  by an ophthalmologist who will be unaware of the perioperative fluid administration regimen.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
